intro: Sida urosepala, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Sida urosepala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
